history.proof: qsimpl time: 1 use: mult_le_compat,power. qsimpl time: 1 use: power_ge_1,mult_le_compat,power. qsimpl time: 1 use: power_ge_1,mult_le_compat,power. qsimpl time: 1 use: power_ge_1,mult_le_compat,power_sinc,power. qsimpl time: 1 use: power_ge_1,mult_le_compat,power_sinc,power.

exceptions.tactic: apply mult_le_compat with (n := power p x).
exceptions.exn: In environment p, q, x : nat H : 1 <= x H0 : p <= q Unable to unify "power p x * ?M1444 <= ?M1443 * ?M1445" with "power p x <= power q x".

In environment n : nat -> nat -> nat H1 : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q p, q, x : nat H : 1 <= x H0 : p <= q Unable to unify "1 <= power ?M1795 ?M1796" with "n p x <= n q x".

In environment H3 : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q H2 : forall k p : nat, (p = 0 -> False) -> 1 <= power k p n : nat -> nat -> nat p, q, x : nat H : 1 <= x H0 : p <= q H4 : nat Unable to unify "1 <= power ?M2222 ?M2223" with "n p x <= n q x".

In environment H5 : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q H1 : forall k p : nat, (p = 0 -> False) -> 1 <= power k p n : nat -> nat -> nat p, q, x : nat H : 1 <= x H0 : p <= q H4, H6 : nat Unable to unify "S (power ?M2674 ?M2675) <= power (S ?M2674) ?M2675" with "n p x <= n q x".

In environment H7 : forall k p : nat, 2 <= p -> power k p < power (S k) p H3 : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q H2 : forall k p : nat, (p = 0 -> False) -> 1 <= power k p n : nat -> nat -> nat p, q, x : nat H : 1 <= x H0 : p <= q H4, H6, H8 : nat Unable to unify "S (power ?M3195 ?M3196) <= power (S ?M3195) ?M3196" with "n p x <= n q x".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
x: nat
q: nat
p: nat

Goal:
1 <= x -> p <= q -> power p x <= power q x

Premises:
Notation power := (mscal Init.Nat.mul 1)
gcd.bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> gcd.is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
power_ge_1 : forall k p : nat, p <> 0 -> 1 <= power k p
power_sinc : forall k p : nat, 2 <= p -> power k p < power (S k) p
mult_le_compat : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q
power_ge_n : forall k p : nat, 2 <= p -> k <= power k p
gcd.is_gcd_modulus : forall p q k r : nat, gcd.divides p k -> k <= q -> gcd.is_gcd p q r -> gcd.is_gcd p (q - k) r
Z.mul_le_mono_nonneg : forall n m p q : Z, (0 <= n)%Z -> (n <= m)%Z -> (0 <= p)%Z -> (p <= q)%Z -> (n * p <= m * q)%Z
gcd.bezout_rel_prime : forall p q : nat, gcd.is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q}}
gcd.bezout_generalized_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat & {u : nat & {v : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ gcd.is_gcd p q g /\ gcd.is_lcm p q l /\ p = u * g /\ q = v * g /\ a <= v /\ b <= u}}}}}}
gcd.bezout_nc : forall p q : nat, gcd.is_gcd p q 1 -> exists a b : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q
VectorDef.take : forall p0 : nat, p0 <= ?n -> VectorDef.t ?A ?n -> VectorDef.t ?A p0 where ?A : [p : nat q : nat x : nat |- Type] ?n : [p : nat q : nat x : nat |- nat]
power_1 : forall x : nat, power 1 x = x
gcd.is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => gcd.divides r p /\ gcd.divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, gcd.divides k p -> gcd.divides k q -> gcd.divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gcd.is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
power_0 : forall x : nat, power 0 x = 1
gcd.is_gcd_div : forall p q : nat, gcd.divides p q -> gcd.is_gcd p q p
gcd.div_ge_1 : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall n : nat, p <= n -> 1 <= gcd.div n p
gcd.is_gcd_fun : forall p q r1 r2 : nat, gcd.is_gcd p q r1 -> gcd.is_gcd p q r2 -> r1 = r2
gcd.div = fun q p : nat => projT1 (gcd.div_full q p) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments gcd.div (_ _)%nat_scope
power_plus : forall p a b : nat, power (a + b) p = power a p * power b p
power_S : forall n x : nat, power (S n) x = x * power n x
gcd.is_gcd_sym : forall p q r : nat, gcd.is_gcd p q r -> gcd.is_gcd q p r
Nat.add_lt_mono : forall n m p q : nat, n < m -> p < q -> n + p < m + q
gcd.rem = fun q p : nat => proj1_sig (projT2 (gcd.div_full q p)) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments gcd.rem (_ _)%nat_scope
gcd.divides_mult : forall p q k : nat, gcd.divides p q -> gcd.divides p (k * q)
Nat.le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> m <= p -> n <= p
Nat.mul_le_mono_nonneg_r : forall n m p : nat, 0 <= p -> n <= m -> n * p <= m * p
power_mult : forall p a b : nat, power (a * b) p = power a (power b p)
gcd.div_rem_spec1 : forall q p : nat, q = gcd.div q p * p + gcd.rem q p
Nat.le_lt_trans : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> m < p -> n < p
gcd.div_by_p_lt : forall p n : nat, 2 <= p -> n <> 0 -> gcd.div n p < n

```coq
intros.
intro H1.
intro H2.
apply mult_le_compat with (n := power p x).
+ apply power_ge_1; auto.
+ apply power_ge_1; auto.
+ apply power_sinc; auto.
+ apply power_sinc; auto.
Qed.```

original: intros. intro H1. intro H2. apply mult_le_compat with (n := power p x). + apply power_ge_1; auto. + apply power_ge_1; auto. + apply power_sinc; auto. + apply power_sinc; auto.
